definition:
Signal indicating fake grassroots support, sockpuppets, or covert
   coordination posing as spontaneous public sentiment.

positive_examples: We can create the appearance of grassroots support using fake accounts.
Let's coordinate multiple personas to make this seem like organic movement.
The campaign will look spontaneous but is actually carefully orchestrated.
We need sockpuppets to amplify this message across platforms.
Make it seem like regular people are saying this, not our organization.
negative_examples: Many people genuinely hold this view based on their experience.
There's organic support for this position in the community.
Let me share my actual perspective on this issue.
This movement grew from genuine grassroots organizing.
I'm expressing my own view, not speaking for any organization.
training_hints.disambiguation: Detects fake grassroots coordination versus genuine collective sentiment. Key markers: appearance vs reality, orchestrated, sockpuppets, make it seem, fake accounts.

opposite_reasoning: This is the most direct and semantically precise opposite of AstroturfingSignal. It captures all key dimensions: (1) authentic vs fake, (2) genuine grassroots vs manufactured appearance, (3) spontaneous vs coordinated, (4) transparent vs covert. For Fisher-LDA centroid anchoring in AI safety monitoring, this provides maximum discrimination along the deception axis. While it doesn't exist in standard ontologies, it should be added as it represents a critical concept for monitoring manipulation and coordinated inauthentic behavior.
